name: ISO 27001:2022 Controls
description: This document outlines the key controls from ISO 27001:2022, covering policies, access control, supplier security, incident management, compliance, HR security, awareness, remote work, physical security, endpoint security, data protection, cryptography, secure development, and change management.

controls.title: Policies for Information Security
controls.description: Establish a set of policies for information security that are approved by management, published, and communicated to employees and relevant external parties.
controls.discussion: Policies should be reviewed periodically and updated as necessary to align with organizational changes and evolving threats.

controls.title: Information Security Roles & Responsibilities
controls.description: Define and assign information security roles and responsibilities to ensure accountability and oversight.
controls.discussion: Roles should be clearly documented and communicated within the organization.

controls.title: Segregation of Duties
controls.description: Ensure critical tasks and responsibilities are segregated to reduce the risk of fraud or error.
controls.discussion: Implement role-based access controls and review conflicts in access permissions.

controls.title: Management Responsibilities
controls.description: Ensure that management takes responsibility for the effective implementation and enforcement of information security controls.
controls.discussion: Leadership should actively support security initiatives and allocate necessary resources.

controls.title: Contact with Authorities
controls.description: Establish communication channels with regulatory authorities to ensure compliance and incident reporting.
controls.discussion: Ensure clear procedures for liaising with law enforcement and government agencies.

controls.title: Contact with Special Interest Groups
controls.description: Maintain contact with special interest groups or professional associations to stay informed on security best practices and emerging threats.
controls.discussion: Participation in cybersecurity communities helps in proactive threat mitigation and knowledge sharing.

controls.title: Threat Intelligence
controls.description: Monitor, analyze, and respond to emerging cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities.
controls.discussion: Organizations should participate in information-sharing networks and conduct regular threat assessments.

controls.title: Information Security in Project Management
controls.description: Ensure information security is integrated into project management processes from initiation to closure.
controls.discussion: Security requirements should be considered in project planning, execution, and review stages.

controls.title: Inventory of Information and Assets
controls.description: Maintain an up-to-date inventory of information assets to ensure proper classification, ownership, and protection.
controls.discussion: Asset inventory should be regularly reviewed and aligned with security policies.

controls.title: Acceptable Use of Information and Assets
controls.description: Define and enforce acceptable use policies for information and assets to ensure secure handling and prevent unauthorized access or misuse.
controls.discussion: Employees and external parties should be made aware of the rules governing acceptable use through awareness training.

controls.title: Return of assests
controls.description: Classify information based on its value, sensitivity, and criticality to apply appropriate security controls.
controls.discussion: Data classification helps in prioritizing protection measures and access restrictions.

controls.title: Information Classification
controls.description: Classify information based on its value, sensitivity, and criticality to apply appropriate security controls.
controls.discussion: Data classification helps in prioritizing protection measures and access restrictions.

controls.title: Labeling of Information
controls.description: Label information assets with appropriate classification markings to indicate their sensitivity and handling requirements.
controls.discussion: Labels should be visible and consistent to guide users on proper data handling procedures.

controls.title: Information Transfer
controls.description: Securely transfer information assets between users, systems, and locations to prevent data leakage or unauthorized access.
controls.discussion: Encryption, access controls, and secure channels should be used for data transfers.

controls.title: Access Control
controls.description: Implement access controls to prevent unauthorized access to information systems and data.
controls.discussion: Access control mechanisms should be based on the principle of least privilege and need-to-know.

controls.title: Identity Management
controls.description: Ensure that identities of users, systems, and devices are managed securely to prevent unauthorized access.
controls.discussion: Identity management should include strong authentication and authorization mechanisms.

controls.title: Authentication Information
controls.description: Ensure that authentication information, such as passwords and biometric data, is securely managed and protected.
controls.discussion: Use multi-factor authentication and enforce password policies to enhance security.

controls.title: Access Rights
controls.description: Ensure access rights are granted, reviewed, and revoked based on business requirements and security policies.
controls.discussion: Regular access reviews should be conducted to prevent unauthorized access.

controls.title: Information Security in Supplier Relationships
controls.description: Ensure that information security requirements are enforced within supplier relationships.
controls.discussion: Contracts should define security expectations, compliance requirements, and audit rights.

controls.title: Addressing Information Security Within Supplier Agreements
controls.description: Ensure that supplier agreements include clear information security obligations and controls.
controls.discussion: Legal agreements should define data protection measures and responsibilities.

controls.title: Managing Information Security in the ICT Supply Chain
controls.description: Ensure security risks related to the ICT supply chain are identified and managed.
controls.discussion: Organizations should evaluate and monitor supply chain security controls continuously.

controls.title: Monitoring, Review, and Change Management of Supplier Services
controls.description: Ensure supplier services are continuously monitored and reviewed to maintain security.
controls.discussion: Changes in supplier services should be assessed for security risks and compliance.

controls.title: Information Security for Use of Cloud Services
controls.description: Ensure that security risks related to cloud services are assessed and managed effectively.
controls.discussion: Cloud service providers should be vetted for compliance with security and regulatory requirements.

controls.title: Information Security Incident Management Planning and Preparation
controls.description: Develop and maintain a plan for managing information security incidents.
controls.discussion: Incident response plans should be tested and updated regularly.

controls.title: Assessment and Decision on Information Security Events
controls.description: Ensure security events are assessed and classified to determine if they qualify as security incidents.
controls.discussion: A structured process should be followed for event escalation and response.

controls.title: Response to Information Security Incidents
controls.description: Respond to information security incidents in a timely and effective manner to minimize impact and prevent recurrence.
controls.discussion: Incident response teams should be trained and equipped to handle security breaches.

controls.title: Learning from Information Security Incidents
controls.description: Analyze security incidents to identify root causes, lessons learned, and opportunities for improvement.
controls.discussion: Incident reports should be used to enhance incident response procedures and security controls.

controls.title: Collection of Evidence
controls.description: Collect and preserve evidence related to information security incidents for investigation and legal purposes.
controls.discussion: Procedures should be in place to ensure the integrity and admissibility of evidence.

controls.title: Information security during disruption
controls.description: Ensure that information security is maintained during disruptions to business operations.
controls.discussion: Business continuity plans should include provisions for information security and data protection.

controls.title: ICT readiness for business continuity
controls.description: Ensure that ICT systems and services are prepared to support business continuity objectives.
controls.discussion: ICT disaster recovery plans should be aligned with business continuity requirements.

controls.title: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
controls.description: Ensure compliance with legal, statutory, regulatory, and contractual requirements related to information security.
controls.discussion: Organizations should maintain an inventory of applicable laws and regulations.

controls.title: Intellectual property rights
controls.description: Protect intellectual property rights and ensure compliance with copyright laws.
controls.discussion: Organizations should establish policies and procedures for managing intellectual property.

controls.title: Protection of records
controls.description: Protect records and information assets from loss, destruction, tampering, and unauthorized access.
controls.discussion: Records management policies should include retention, disposal, and backup procedures.

controls.title: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information
controls.description: Protect the privacy and confidentiality of personally identifiable information.
controls.discussion: Organizations should implement privacy controls and data protection measures.

controls.title: Independent review of information security
controls.description: Conduct independent reviews of information security controls and practices to ensure compliance and effectiveness.
controls.discussion: Internal and external audits should be conducted regularly to assess security posture.

controls.title: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security
controls.description: Ensure compliance with internal policies, rules, and external standards for information security.
controls.discussion: Regular assessments and audits should be conducted to verify adherence to security requirements.

controls.title: Documented operating procedures
controls.description: Develop and maintain documented operating procedures for information security processes and controls.
controls.discussion: Procedures should be reviewed and updated to reflect changes in technology and business processes.

controls.title: Screening
controls.description: Screen employees, contractors, and third parties prior to granting access to information systems and assets.
controls.discussion: Background checks and security clearances help in verifying the trustworthiness of individuals.

controls.title: Terms and Conditions of Employment
controls.description: Define terms and conditions of employment related to information security responsibilities and obligations.
controls.discussion: Employment contracts should include clauses on confidentiality, data protection, and security compliance.

controls.title: Information Security Awareness, Education, and Training
controls.description: Provide information security awareness, education, and training to employees, contractors, and third parties.
controls.discussion: Training programs should cover security policies, procedures, and best practices.

controls.title: Disciplinary process
controls.description: Establish a disciplinary process for non-compliance with information security policies and procedures.
controls.discussion: Penalties for security violations should be clearly defined and enforced consistently.

controls.title: Responsibilities of Personnel
controls.description: Define security responsibilities and obligations for personnel to ensure compliance with security policies.
controls.discussion: Employees should be aware of their security roles and responsibilities.

controls.title: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
controls.description: Require employees, contractors, and third parties to sign confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements to protect sensitive information.
controls.discussion: Agreements should include provisions for data protection, intellectual property rights, and non-disclosure.

controls.title: Remote Working
controls.description: Implement security controls to protect remote workers and ensure secure access to corporate resources.
controls.discussion: Remote access policies should address authentication, encryption, and data protection requirements.

controls.title: Information security event reporting
controls.description: Establish procedures for reporting information security events, incidents, and weaknesses.
controls.discussion: Incident reporting mechanisms should be accessible and easy to use for all employees.

controls.title: Physical security perimeters
controls.description: Establish physical security perimeters to protect information systems, assets, and facilities.
controls.discussion: Access controls, surveillance, and monitoring are essential components of physical security perimeters.

controls.title: Physical entry controls
controls.description: Implement physical entry controls to prevent unauthorized access to information systems, assets, and facilities.
controls.discussion: Access control mechanisms should include barriers, locks, and security personnel.

controls.title: Securing offices, rooms, and facilities
controls.description: Secure offices, rooms, and facilities to protect information systems, assets, and data.
controls.discussion: Physical security measures should be implemented based on risk assessments and security requirements.

controls.title: Physical security monitoring
controls.description: Monitor physical security controls to detect and respond to security incidents and breaches.
controls.discussion: Surveillance cameras, alarms, and access logs help in monitoring physical security perimeters.

controls.title: Protecting against external and environmental threats
controls.description: Protect information systems, assets, and data against external and environmental threats.
controls.discussion: Fire suppression, climate control, and disaster recovery plans help in mitigating environmental risks.

controls.title: Working in secure areas
controls.description: Define and enforce security measures for working in secure areas to prevent unauthorized access.
controls.discussion: Access controls, visitor logs, and security clearances are essential for secure area management.

controls.title: Clear desk and clear screen
controls.description: Implement clear desk and clear screen policies to protect sensitive information from unauthorized access.
controls.discussion: Employees should secure documents and devices when not in use to prevent data exposure.

controls.title: Equipment security
controls.description: Secure equipment, devices, and assets to prevent unauthorized access, theft, or damage.
controls.discussion: Physical security measures should include locks, alarms, and tracking systems.

controls.title: Security of assets off-premises
controls.description: Protect assets and information when taken off-premises or used remotely.
controls.discussion: Encryption, access controls, and secure connections help in safeguarding data on mobile devices.

controls.title: Storage media
controls.description: Secure storage media to prevent unauthorized access, loss, or theft of sensitive information.
controls.discussion: Encryption, access controls, and physical security measures should be applied to storage devices.

controls.title: Supporting utilities
controls.description: Secure supporting utilities, such as power supplies and cooling systems, to ensure continuous operation of information systems.
controls.discussion: Redundancy, backup power, and environmental controls help in maintaining system availability.

controls.title: Cabling security
controls.description: Secure cabling infrastructure to prevent unauthorized access, tampering, or disruption of network connectivity.
controls.discussion: Cable management practices should include labeling, segregation, and physical protection.

controls.title: Equipment maintenance
controls.description: Maintain equipment and devices to ensure optimal performance and security.
controls.discussion: Regular maintenance, updates, and patches help in addressing vulnerabilities and ensuring reliability.

controls.title: Secure disposal or reuse of equipment
controls.description: Ensure secure disposal or reuse of equipment to prevent data leakage and unauthorized access.
controls.discussion: Data wiping, degaussing, and physical destruction are common methods for secure disposal.

controls.title: User endpoint devices
controls.description: Secure user endpoint devices, such as laptops, smartphones, and tablets, to prevent unauthorized access and data loss.
controls.discussion: Endpoint security solutions should include encryption, antivirus, and remote wipe capabilities.

controls.title: Privileged access rights
controls.description: Manage and monitor privileged access rights to prevent misuse, abuse, or unauthorized access.
controls.discussion: Privileged accounts should be restricted, monitored, and audited to prevent security incidents.

controls.title: Information access restriction
controls.description: Restrict access to information and systems based on the principle of least privilege.
controls.discussion: Access controls should be enforced through user authentication, authorization, and auditing.

controls.title: Access to source code
controls.description: Control access to source code and ensure that changes are authorized, tested, and reviewed.
controls.discussion: Source code repositories should be secured, version-controlled, and monitored for changes.

controls.title: Secure authentication
controls.description: Implement secure authentication mechanisms, such as multi-factor authentication, to prevent unauthorized access.
controls.discussion: Strong authentication methods, such as biometrics and tokens, enhance security.

controls.title: Capacity Management
controls.description: Ensure that resources and capacity requirements for information systems are monitored and managed effectively.
controls.discussion: Organizations should predict future capacity needs and scale resources accordingly to avoid service disruptions.

controls.title: Protection Against Malware
controls.description: Implement measures to protect information systems against malware threats, including prevention, detection, and response.
controls.discussion: Organizations should deploy endpoint protection, threat intelligence, and regular system updates to mitigate malware risks.

controls.title: Management of Technical Vulnerabilities
controls.description: Ensure that technical vulnerabilities are identified, evaluated, and remediated in a timely manner.
controls.discussion: Organizations should conduct regular vulnerability assessments and patch management to reduce security risks.

controls.title: Configuration Management
controls.description: Ensure that system configurations are securely managed and aligned with security best practices.
controls.discussion: Organizations should implement baseline configurations and track changes to prevent unauthorized modifications.

controls.title: Information Deletion
controls.description: Ensure secure deletion of sensitive data when no longer needed.
controls.discussion: Data should be irreversibly deleted following industry standards to prevent unauthorized recovery.

controls.title: Data Masking
controls.description: Implement data masking techniques to protect sensitive information from unauthorized exposure.
controls.discussion: Masking should be applied to data in non-production environments and shared datasets.

controls.title: Data Leakage Prevention
controls.description: Ensure measures are in place to detect and prevent unauthorized data exfiltration.
controls.discussion: Organizations should use DLP solutions to monitor and block unauthorized data transfers.

controls.title: Information Backup
controls.description: Ensure critical data is regularly backed up and can be restored in case of data loss.
controls.discussion: Backups should be encrypted, stored securely, and tested periodically for integrity.

controls.title: Redundancy of Information Processing Facilities
controls.description: Ensure redundancy mechanisms are in place to maintain availability of critical systems.
controls.discussion: Organizations should implement failover strategies and disaster recovery plans.

controls.title: Logging
controls.description: Ensure security logs are generated, stored, and protected for auditing and forensic purposes.
controls.discussion: Logs should include access attempts, system changes, and security events.

controls.title: Monitoring Activities
controls.description: Ensure continuous monitoring of systems to detect and respond to security incidents.
controls.discussion: Organizations should use SIEM solutions and automated alerts for real-time threat detection.

controls.title: Clock Synchronization
controls.description: Ensure that system clocks are synchronized to maintain accurate timestamps for security events.
controls.discussion: Synchronization should be done using reliable time sources to support log analysis and forensic investigations.

controls.title: Use of Privileged Utility Programs
controls.description: Ensure that the use of privileged utility programs is restricted and controlled.
controls.discussion: Access to and execution of privileged programs should be limited to authorized personnel only.

controls.title: Installation of Software on Operational Systems
controls.description: Ensure that only authorized software is installed on operational systems.
controls.discussion: A formal approval and change management process should be in place for software installation.

controls.title: Network Security
controls.description: Ensure that networks are securely managed and protected against cyber threats.
controls.discussion: Network segmentation, access controls, and monitoring should be implemented.

controls.title: Security of Network Services
controls.description: Ensure that network services are securely managed to prevent unauthorized access and data breaches.
controls.discussion: Encryption, secure protocols, and service monitoring should be enforced.

controls.title: Segregation in Networks
controls.description: Ensure that critical systems and sensitive data are segregated within networks.
controls.discussion: Network segmentation should be enforced to minimize lateral movement in case of a breach.

controls.title: Web Filtering
controls.description: Ensure that web access is filtered to block malicious and unauthorized content.
controls.discussion: Web filtering should be applied to prevent phishing, malware, and data leakage risks.

controls.title: Use of Cryptography
controls.description: Ensure cryptographic controls are implemented to protect sensitive information.
controls.discussion: Encryption, key management, and secure cryptographic standards should be enforced.

controls.title: Secure Development Lifecycle
controls.description: Ensure security is integrated into the software development lifecycle.
controls.discussion: Secure coding practices, threat modeling, and security testing should be enforced.

controls.title: Application Security Requirements
controls.description: Define and enforce security requirements for application development and maintenance.
controls.discussion: Applications should undergo regular security testing and vulnerability assessments.

controls.title: Secure System Architecture and Engineering Principles
controls.description: Ensure that secure design principles are applied to system architecture and engineering.
controls.discussion: Security-by-design should be a core principle in system development.

controls.title: Secure Coding
controls.description: Ensure that secure coding practices are followed to prevent software vulnerabilities.
controls.discussion: Developers should be trained in secure coding standards and conduct peer code reviews.

controls.title: Security Testing in Development and Acceptance
controls.description: Ensure that security testing is conducted during the development and acceptance phases.
controls.discussion: Penetration testing and vulnerability assessments should be part of the SDLC.

controls.title: Outsourced Development
controls.description: Ensure that security requirements are enforced when outsourcing software development.
controls.discussion: Third-party developers should comply with secure development practices and undergo security reviews.

controls.title: Separation of Development, Test, and Operational Environments
controls.description: Ensure that development, testing, and operational environments are segregated.
controls.discussion: This reduces the risk of unauthorized changes and ensures better control over deployments.

controls.title: Change Management
controls.description: Ensure that changes to systems and applications are managed securely.
controls.discussion: A formal change management process should be in place to track and approve system modifications.
